articles.description: All the latest football news and Premier League reaction to Wednesday's results as Liverpool lose ground in title race.
articles.title: Premier League reaction: Liverpool drop points as Chelsea, Arsenal & Man City win

articles.description: Three-time Olympic dressage gold medallist Charlotte Dujardin banned for one-year and fined £8,886 for "excessively" whipping a horse.
articles.title: Charlotte Dujardin: Three-time Olympic champion handed one-year ban

articles.description: Liverpool's 3-3 draw at Newcastle is described as "one of the best games of the season" - and gives their rivals hope in the battle for the Premier League title.
articles.title: Newcastle 3-3 Liverpool: 'Best game of season' - draw gives Reds' Premier League title rivals fresh hope

articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Athletic Club vs Real Madrid in the Spanish La Liga
articles.title: Athletic Club vs Real Madrid: Spanish La Liga stats & head-to-head - BBC Sport

articles.description: Arsenal comfortably beat Manchester United as Ruben Amorim suffers his first defeat since taking charge of the Red Devils.
articles.title: Arsenal 2-0 Man Utd: Defeat for Ruben Amorim as William Saliba and Jurrien Timber score goals for Gunners

articles.description: England captain Ben Stokes backs opener Zak Crawley to improve his dismal record against New Zealand in the second Test in Wellington.
articles.title: New Zealand v England: Ben Stokes backs opener Zak Crawley

articles.description: Sky Brown, William Ellard and Luke Littler are on the shortlist for BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year.
articles.title: Young Sports Personality of the Year 2024 nominees: Sky Brown, William Ellard and Luke Littler

articles.description: Pep Guardiola says he is "so happy" to have Kevin de Bruyne back after the midfielder played an integral role in Manchester City's win against Nottingham Forest.
articles.title: Kevin de Bruyne: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola 'so happy' midfielder is back

articles.description: Former Aston Villa midfielder Thomas Hitzlsperger gives his thoughts on the controversy surrounding the Premier League's Rainbow Laces campaign.
articles.title: Rainbow armbands: Thomas Hitzlsperger on controversy surrounding this year's LGBTQ+ campaign

articles.description: Celtic's lead looks insurmountable after they grind out victory over dogged Aberdeen at rain-lashed Pittdorie to go seven points clear, writes Tom English.
articles.title: Aberdeen 0-1 Celtic: 'Nobody is catching domestic machine Celtic now'
